prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Kay Faraday
Description: A self-styled Great Thief and so-called "second Yatagarasu" who's always looking to bag the greatest treasure of all -- the truth.
Character 1
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective from the local precinct who's always first on the scene at any murder investigation.
Character 2
Name: Bronco Knight
Description: A former bodyguard who killed his team leader. He is set to stand trial soon.
Character 3
Name: Eddie Fender
Description: A defense attorney I have known for a long time, but haven't seen in years. Apparently, he lived abroad for a while.
Character 4
Name: Rocco Carcerato
Description: An inmate and former boxer who is obsessed with training. Has a pet polar bear named Teddy.
Character 5
Name: Verity Gavèlle
Description: A district court judge and member of the Committee for Prosecutorial Excellence, who also acts as its mouthpiece.
Character 6
Name: Eustace Winner
Description: A rookie prosecutor who's taken over my cases on the Committee's orders.
Character 7
Name: Simeon Saint
Description: The suspect in this case. A timid young man who seems an unlikely murderer.
Character 8
Name: Fifi Laguarde
Description: Warden of the prison. An animal lover who considers physical contact to be very important.
Character 9
Name: Frank Sahwit
Description: The prison inmate who first discovered the body. Currently training to be a pet stylist.
Character 10
Name: Bodhidharma Kanis
Description: A blind ex-assassin whose favored tools were a black dog and a knife. The tinkling of small bells used to accompany his appearance.
Character 11
Name: Shi-Long Lang
Description: An Interpol agent with an unrivaled arrest rate. Originally from Zheng Fa.
Character 12
Name: Regina Berry
Description: Head animal trainer at the Berry Big Circus, and Saint's boss.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 1
Name: Building Layout
Description: A map of the facility, including the detention center and the prison proper.
Evidence 2
Name: Mr. Knight's Body
Description: Cause of death: Stab wound to the throat. Death would have been instant. There is also a small cut on his scalp from when he suffered a blow to the head. [info] The victim had a ring on his right hand, which was covered by a sheet when the body was discovered.  Killed instantly by a stab wound to the throat. The body is covered in dirt. There is also a small cut on his scalp from when he suffered a blow to the head. Killed instantly by a stab wound to the throat. There is also a small cut on his scalp from when he suffered a blow to the head. A sweet scent can be detected.
Evidence 3
Name: Pocket Chess Set
Description: A folding chessboard with the pieces stored inside. It appears to have belonged to the victim. A folding chessboard with the pieces stored inside. It belonged to Knight, and was brought to him at his request by Saint. Portable folding chessboard. Belonged to Knight. There is a hidden space inside the chessboard. Knight hid a chisel in here to prevent it from being found by the prison staff.
Evidence 4
Name: Rubber Glove
Description: Only one glove was found at the crime scene. Prison-issued equipment for working inmates. Stained with blood and mud. Found in Workshop A. Used by Sahwit when he was doing his animal styling training. Stained with blood and mud. Found in Workshop A. Sullied after being worn by Sahwit when administering a dark mudpack treatment. Also bloodstained.
Evidence 5
Name: Rope
Description: Discovered on top of Knight's body. Does this mean the victim was tied up?
Evidence 6
Name: Bloodstained Sheet
Description: Colorful tarp found by the victim's body. Some of these were being stored in Workshop A.
Evidence 7
Name: Door Sensor
Description: Fitted to each workshop's door, they detect and react to the prisoners' bracelets when they are near by raising the alarm. They open the doors if an animal is detected, but raise the alarm if an inmate's bracelet is detected. Prisoners are not allowed to move about freely.
Evidence 8
Name: Prison Roll Call
Description: Held three times a day: 7 AM, noon, and 9 PM. The victim's body had not been found at the time of the 7 AM roll call.
Evidence 9
Name: Black Dog
Description: Sahwit claims to have seen this dog biting the victim's throat. He doesn't seem to like me very much.
Evidence 10
Name: Sahwit's Bracelet
Description: Sahwit's bracelet is broken, and can no longer be detected by the prison's sensors. Sahwit's bracelet wasn't working at the time of the incident, and could not be detected by the sensors.
Evidence 11
Name: Dog Chess Piece
Description: Carved for fun by Kanis. He also seems to be engaged in correspondence chess via postal mail.
Evidence 12
Name: Prison Search
Description: Winner, Gavèlle and the warden searched the prison for the murder weapon, but couldn't find anything.
Evidence 13
Name: Wiped Floor
Description: There are signs that the floor in the victim's detention center cell was wiped clean. There are signs that the floor in the victim's cell was wiped clean. I've ordered a test to see if it was blood. There are signs that blood was wiped from the floor of the victim's cell. We're currently checking whose blood it is. There are signs that blood was wiped from the floor of the victim's cell. The blood has been confirmed as Knight's.
Evidence 14
Name: Chess Diagram
Description: The positions of the pieces match those on the board in Kanis's cell. Knight was playing correspondence chess against Kanis. Did the two have some sort of connection?
Evidence 15
Name: Security Camera Footage
Description: Footage of a detention center holding cell showing the victim being attacked by a dark form. The time stamp is off due to a three-hour gap in the footage. This was actually recorded around 9 AM.
Evidence 16
Name: Missing Guard Uniform
Description: Stolen from a guard's locker in the detention center corridor on March 26th.
Evidence 17
Name: Mr. Knight's Cell Key
Description: A guard was attacked and his keys, including the one to Knight's cell, were stolen. They have yet to be recovered. A guard was attacked the day before the murder, and his keys were stolen. They were found in Carcerato's possession.
Evidence 18
Name: Security Gates
Description: Deployed at the entrances to both the detention center and the prison proper. Capable of detecting items made of metal.
Evidence 19
Name: Tunnel Prints
Description: A photo of the tunnel between the prison and the detention center. It seems to depict the paw prints of a dog. A photo of the tunnel between the prison and the detention center. Shows paw prints made by a bear.
Evidence 20
Name: Autopsy Report
Description: The interim report suggests that the cause of death was a stab wound to the neck, inflicted by a sharp blade. Death was instantaneous. Estimated time of death is between 3 AM and 6 AM on the 27th. Instant death from a stab wound to the neck.
Evidence 21
Name: Chisel
Description: Contains traces of blood. Hidden by Kanis inside his dog's mouth. Has a small bell attached to it. Belonged to Knight. Hidden by Kanis in Helmut's mouth in order to avoid suspicion.
Evidence 22
Name: Mr. Kanis's Bells
Description: Only two such bells exist. One is attached to Helmut the dog, the other to Kanis's knife, which was seized by the police during his arrest.
Evidence 23
Name: Mr. Saint's Trick
Description: A contraption that used the well, a very heavy weight, three pulleys, and two lengths of rope to send Saint flying during the show. Used during the show to send Saint flying. The weights were replaced with the victim's body by someone.
Evidence 24
Name: Breakers
Description: Located in the power room, just off the prison yard. Were they tampered with the night before the body was found?

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Recreation time ended around 10 AM.
Person: Elbird
Testimony 1
Testimony: I returned to this room and went straight to my training.
Person: Elbird
Testimony 2
Testimony: Just as I'd counted to two, I heard a voice shout out, "AAARGH! I've been stabbed!"
Person: Elbird
Testimony 3
Testimony: It sounded like someone in pain, calling out for help. But...
Person: Elbird
Testimony 4
Testimony: I couldn't do anything since I was locked up in my cell. So, I went back to my training.
Person: Elbird

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem. The user is asking which evidence and testimony contradict each other. They want just one pair. Let me go through the evidence and testimonies provided.

First, let me look at the testimonies. The testimonies are from Elbird. Testimony 2 says that when he counted to two, he heard someone shout, "AAARGH! I've been stabbed!" Testimony 3 adds that it sounded like someone in pain calling for help. However, the autopsy report (Evidence 20) states that the cause of death was a stab wound to the neck, which caused instant death. If the death was instantaneous, the victim wouldn't have been able to scream after being stabbed. That's a contradiction. The testimony claims the victim shouted after being stabbed, but the evidence says death was immediate. So the testimony (Testimony 2 or 3) would contradict Evidence 20. Wait, let me check the evidence again. Evidence 20 says death was instantaneous. So the testimony about the victim screaming after being stabbed can't be true. The scream would imply the victim was alive after the stabbing, but the evidence says death was instant. Therefore, Testimony 2 or 3 contradicts Evidence 20. However, Evidence 2 also mentions the cause of death as a stab wound to the throat with instant death. Let me check Evidence 2 again. Yes, Evidence 2 says "Death would have been instant." So maybe the contradiction is between Testimony 2 and Evidence 2. The testimony says the victim screamed after being stabbed, but Evidence 2 states death was instant. That's a direct contradiction. Therefore, the pair would be Evidence 2 and Testimony 2. But let me check the testimonies again. Testimony 2 is the one where he heard the shout, and Testimony 3 continues that it was a call for help. Both are part of the same event. The key point is the scream after the stabbing, which can't happen if death was instantaneous. So the correct contradiction is between Testimony 2 (or 3) and Evidence 2 (or 20). Let me check which evidence is more precise. Evidence 2 and 20 both mention instant death. Evidence 2 is the body's description, while Evidence 20 is the autopsy report. Both state instant death. The testimony in question is Testimony 2 where the shout is heard. So the contradiction is between Testimony 2 and Evidence 2 or 20. The user might have intended Evidence 2 as the primary source. Therefore, the correct pair is Evidence 2 and Testimony 2. Wait, but the user might have a different reasoning. Let me confirm. If the death was instant, the victim couldn't scream. So Testimony 2's account of hearing a scream after the stabbing is impossible. Therefore, that testimony contradicts the evidence stating instant death. So the evidence would be either 2 or 20. Let's check their numbers. The answer requires the evidence number and testimony number. Looking at the given data, Evidence 2 is Mr. Knight's Body, which states death was instant. Testimony 2 is Elbird's statement about hearing the shout. Therefore, the pair is Evidence 2 and Testimony 2. Alternatively, maybe the security camera footage (Evidence 15) shows the attack at around 9 AM, but the autopsy report (Evidence 20) says time of death between 3 AM and 6 AM. That would be another contradiction. Wait, that's a different angle. Let me check Evidence 15: the security camera footage shows the attack around 9 AM, but the time of death is between 3-6 AM. That's a contradiction. The camera footage's timestamp is off, but it's recorded around 9 AM. So if the actual time of the attack is 9 AM, but the time of death is 3-6 AM, that's a conflict. So that would mean the camera footage (Evidence 15) contradicts the autopsy report (Evidence 20). However, the user's question is about testimony and evidence. The testimonies are from Elbird. Let me check the testimonies again. The testimonies don't mention time of death directly. The testimonies about hearing the scream would be at the time of the attack, which according to the camera was around 9 AM. But the autopsy says death was 3-6 AM. So if the attack was recorded at 9 AM, but the time of death is 3-6 AM, that's a contradiction. However, the testimony says that during recreation time (which ended at 10 AM), he heard the scream. Wait, Testimony 0 says recreation time ended around 10 AM. Then Testimony 2 is about hearing the shout. So if the murder happened during recreation time, which ended at 10 AM, but the time of death was 3-6 AM, that's a contradiction. But how does that tie into the testimonies? Let me see. If the recreation time ended at 10 AM (Testimony 0), and the scream was heard during that time (Testimony 2 and 3), but the autopsy says death was between 3-6 AM, then the testimony about the scream happening around 10 AM contradicts the time of death in the autopsy. That would be a contradiction between Testimony 2 and Evidence 20. But the problem is the user is asking for one pair. So there are multiple possible contradictions here.

But let me focus on the initial one I thought: the victim couldn't scream if death was instant. So Testimony 2's claim of hearing a scream after being stabbed contradicts Evidence 2 (or 20) which states death was instant. Therefore, the correct pair would be Evidence 2 and Testimony 2. But let's check the exact wording. Testimony 2: "Just as I'd counted to two, I heard a voice shout out, 'AAARGH! I've been stabbed!'" Evidence 2: "Death would have been instant." So if the person was killed instantly, they couldn't have shouted after being stabbed. Therefore, these two contradict each other. That's a solid contradiction. So the answer should be {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 2}.

prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Kay Faraday
Description: A self-styled Great Thief and so-called "second Yatagarasu" who's always looking to bag the greatest treasure of all -- the truth.
Character 1
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective from the local precinct who's always first on the scene at any murder investigation.
Character 2
Name: Bronco Knight
Description: A former bodyguard who killed his team leader. He is set to stand trial soon.
Character 3
Name: Eddie Fender
Description: A defense attorney I have known for a long time, but haven't seen in years. Apparently, he lived abroad for a while.
Character 4
Name: Rocco Carcerato
Description: An inmate and former boxer who is obsessed with training. Has a pet polar bear named Teddy.
Character 5
Name: Verity Gavèlle
Description: A district court judge and member of the Committee for Prosecutorial Excellence, who also acts as its mouthpiece.
Character 6
Name: Eustace Winner
Description: A rookie prosecutor who's taken over my cases on the Committee's orders.
Character 7
Name: Simeon Saint
Description: The suspect in this case. A timid young man who seems an unlikely murderer.
Character 8
Name: Fifi Laguarde
Description: Warden of the prison. An animal lover who considers physical contact to be very important.
Character 9
Name: Frank Sahwit
Description: The prison inmate who first discovered the body. Currently training to be a pet stylist.
Character 10
Name: Bodhidharma Kanis
Description: A blind ex-assassin whose favored tools were a black dog and a knife. The tinkling of small bells used to accompany his appearance.
Character 11
Name: Shi-Long Lang
Description: An Interpol agent with an unrivaled arrest rate. Originally from Zheng Fa.
Character 12
Name: Regina Berry
Description: Head animal trainer at the Berry Big Circus, and Saint's boss.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 1
Name: Building Layout
Description: A map of the facility, including the detention center and the prison proper.
Evidence 2
Name: Mr. Knight's Body
Description: Cause of death: Stab wound to the throat. Death would have been instant. There is also a small cut on his scalp from when he suffered a blow to the head. [info] The victim had a ring on his right hand, which was covered by a sheet when the body was discovered.  Killed instantly by a stab wound to the throat. The body is covered in dirt. There is also a small cut on his scalp from when he suffered a blow to the head. Killed instantly by a stab wound to the throat. There is also a small cut on his scalp from when he suffered a blow to the head. A sweet scent can be detected.
Evidence 3
Name: Pocket Chess Set
Description: A folding chessboard with the pieces stored inside. It appears to have belonged to the victim. A folding chessboard with the pieces stored inside. It belonged to Knight, and was brought to him at his request by Saint. Portable folding chessboard. Belonged to Knight. There is a hidden space inside the chessboard. Knight hid a chisel in here to prevent it from being found by the prison staff.
Evidence 4
Name: Rubber Glove
Description: Only one glove was found at the crime scene. Prison-issued equipment for working inmates. Stained with blood and mud. Found in Workshop A. Used by Sahwit when he was doing his animal styling training. Stained with blood and mud. Found in Workshop A. Sullied after being worn by Sahwit when administering a dark mudpack treatment. Also bloodstained.
Evidence 5
Name: Rope
Description: Discovered on top of Knight's body. Does this mean the victim was tied up?
Evidence 6
Name: Bloodstained Sheet
Description: Colorful tarp found by the victim's body. Some of these were being stored in Workshop A.
Evidence 7
Name: Door Sensor
Description: Fitted to each workshop's door, they detect and react to the prisoners' bracelets when they are near by raising the alarm. They open the doors if an animal is detected, but raise the alarm if an inmate's bracelet is detected. Prisoners are not allowed to move about freely.
Evidence 8
Name: Prison Roll Call
Description: Held three times a day: 7 AM, noon, and 9 PM. The victim's body had not been found at the time of the 7 AM roll call.
Evidence 9
Name: Black Dog
Description: Sahwit claims to have seen this dog biting the victim's throat. He doesn't seem to like me very much.
Evidence 10
Name: Sahwit's Bracelet
Description: Sahwit's bracelet is broken, and can no longer be detected by the prison's sensors. Sahwit's bracelet wasn't working at the time of the incident, and could not be detected by the sensors.
Evidence 11
Name: Dog Chess Piece
Description: Carved for fun by Kanis. He also seems to be engaged in correspondence chess via postal mail.
Evidence 12
Name: Prison Search
Description: Winner, Gavèlle and the warden searched the prison for the murder weapon, but couldn't find anything.
Evidence 13
Name: Wiped Floor
Description: There are signs that the floor in the victim's detention center cell was wiped clean. There are signs that the floor in the victim's cell was wiped clean. I've ordered a test to see if it was blood. There are signs that blood was wiped from the floor of the victim's cell. We're currently checking whose blood it is. There are signs that blood was wiped from the floor of the victim's cell. The blood has been confirmed as Knight's.
Evidence 14
Name: Chess Diagram
Description: The positions of the pieces match those on the board in Kanis's cell. Knight was playing correspondence chess against Kanis. Did the two have some sort of connection?
Evidence 15
Name: Security Camera Footage
Description: Footage of a detention center holding cell showing the victim being attacked by a dark form. The time stamp is off due to a three-hour gap in the footage. This was actually recorded around 9 AM.
Evidence 16
Name: Missing Guard Uniform
Description: Stolen from a guard's locker in the detention center corridor on March 26th.
Evidence 17
Name: Mr. Knight's Cell Key
Description: A guard was attacked and his keys, including the one to Knight's cell, were stolen. They have yet to be recovered. A guard was attacked the day before the murder, and his keys were stolen. They were found in Carcerato's possession.
Evidence 18
Name: Security Gates
Description: Deployed at the entrances to both the detention center and the prison proper. Capable of detecting items made of metal.
Evidence 19
Name: Tunnel Prints
Description: A photo of the tunnel between the prison and the detention center. It seems to depict the paw prints of a dog. A photo of the tunnel between the prison and the detention center. Shows paw prints made by a bear.
Evidence 20
Name: Autopsy Report
Description: The interim report suggests that the cause of death was a stab wound to the neck, inflicted by a sharp blade. Death was instantaneous. Estimated time of death is between 3 AM and 6 AM on the 27th. Instant death from a stab wound to the neck.
Evidence 21
Name: Chisel
Description: Contains traces of blood. Hidden by Kanis inside his dog's mouth. Has a small bell attached to it. Belonged to Knight. Hidden by Kanis in Helmut's mouth in order to avoid suspicion.
Evidence 22
Name: Mr. Kanis's Bells
Description: Only two such bells exist. One is attached to Helmut the dog, the other to Kanis's knife, which was seized by the police during his arrest.
Evidence 23
Name: Mr. Saint's Trick
Description: A contraption that used the well, a very heavy weight, three pulleys, and two lengths of rope to send Saint flying during the show. Used during the show to send Saint flying. The weights were replaced with the victim's body by someone.
Evidence 24
Name: Breakers
Description: Located in the power room, just off the prison yard. Were they tampered with the night before the body was found?

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: There is a rather well-known technique among the prisoners here...
Person: Sahwit
Testimony 1
Testimony: If the hand with the bracelet stays in the room, you can step out without sounding the alarm.
Person: Sahwit
Testimony 2
Testimony: That's how I was able to peek into the adjacent room.
Person: Sahwit
Testimony 3
Testimony: The moment I realized that the man inside was dead, I let out a scream.
Person: Sahwit
Testimony 4
Testimony: And to my horror, there was a black dog biting his neck!
Person: Sahwit
Testimony 5
Testimony: He most likely had passed away already. His hands moved nary an inch...
Person: Sahwit
Testimony 6
Testimony: The ring with the snowflake insignia glimmered, with no purpose but to catch my eye.
Person: Sahwit

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. The goal is to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. So, first, I need to go through all the testimonies and cross-reference them with the evidence provided.

Starting with the testimonies given by Sahwit (Testimonies 0-6). Let's look at each one and see if any of them conflict with the evidence.

Testimony 3 says: "The moment I realized that the man inside was dead, I let out a scream." Sahwit claims he found the body and screamed upon realizing the man was dead. Then, Testimony 4 adds: "And to my horror, there was a black dog biting his neck!" So he saw a dog actively biting the neck. 

Looking at the evidence related to the cause of death. Evidence 2 (Mr. Knight's Body) states that the cause of death was a stab wound to the throat, which was instant. The autopsy report (Evidence 20) confirms this, saying death was instantaneous from a stab wound. Additionally, the black dog is mentioned in Evidence 9, where Sahwit claims to have seen the dog biting the throat. 

However, the contradiction here is that if the death was instantaneous from a stab wound, the dog biting the neck would have occurred after death. But Testimony 4 describes the dog in the act of biting the neck at the moment Sahwit discovered the body. If the victim was already dead (as per the autopsy and Evidence 2), the dog couldn't have been biting the throat to cause death. Therefore, Sahwit's testimony about seeing the dog biting the neck (Testimony 4) contradicts the evidence that the cause of death was a stab wound that killed instantly. The dog's action would have been post-mortem, not the actual cause of death. So Sahwit's account of the dog in the act of killing contradicts the medical evidence of a stab wound causing instant death.

Wait, but the evidence also mentions the black dog in Evidence 9. The dog might have been present, but the actual cause was the stab wound. So Sahwit's Testimony 4 is incorrect in implying the dog was the killer, which contradicts the evidence that the cause was a stabbing. Therefore, the contradiction is between Testimony 4 (dog biting neck as cause) and Evidence 2 (stab wound as cause). But the problem asks for one pair. Let me check the exact wording.

Testimony 4 says "there was a black dog biting his neck!" Evidence 2 says the cause of death was a stab wound. Therefore, if the dog was biting the neck at the time Sahwit saw the body, but the actual cause was a stab wound, then the testimony is conflicting with the evidence. The dog's presence doesn't necessarily contradict, but if Sahwit claims to have seen the dog actively causing the injury that led to death, that's a contradiction. However, the autopsy report (Evidence 20) confirms the stab wound. Therefore, Testimony 4 is contradicted by the evidence showing that the death was from a stab, not a dog bite.

So the pair would be Testimony 4 (index 4) and Evidence 2 (index 2). But let me check other possibilities.

Another angle: Evidence 21 mentions a chisel hidden in the dog's mouth, which has blood traces. The chisel might have been the murder weapon. If the chisel was used for the stab, and the dog was used to carry it, then the dog's presence could be part of the method. However, the testimony about the dog biting the neck (Testimony 4) would imply the dog caused the fatal injury, which contradicts the evidence that the fatal injury was a stab wound. Therefore, Sahwit's testimony about the dog biting the neck at the time of discovery contradicts the evidence that the actual cause was a stab wound. Thus, the contradiction is between Testimony 4 and Evidence 2.

Description: Only two such bells exist. One is attached to Helmut the dog, the other to Kanis's knife, which was seized by the police during his arrest.
Evidence 23
Name: Mr. Saint's Trick
Description: A contraption that used the well, a very heavy weight, three pulleys, and two lengths of rope to send Saint flying during the show. Used during the show to send Saint flying. The weights were replaced with the victim's body by someone.
Evidence 24
Name: Breakers
Description: Located in the power room, just off the prison yard. Were they tampered with the night before the body was found?

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: So, you want to know my reasons for arresting that man?
Person: Debeste
Testimony 1

Person: Debeste

Person: Debeste
Testimony 4
Testimony: How's that? Perfectly simple, perfectly decisive... Right?
Person: Debeste

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's see. The user wants to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. So, I need to look through the testimonies and see which ones make claims that are directly contradicted by the evidence provided.

Looking at the testimonies, most are by Debeste. Let's check each one. Testimony 3 says that the victim's chessboard had Simeon Saint's fingerprints. The evidence related to the chess set is Evidence 3. Evidence 3 mentions that the chess set belonged to Knight and was brought by Saint. So if Saint handled it, his fingerprints would naturally be there, right? That's not necessarily incriminating. But the testimony presents it as unnatural. Wait, Testimony 5 says that only Simeon's prints are unnatural. But according to Evidence 3, Saint brought the chessboard to Knight, so his prints would be expected. The presence of his prints isn't unnatural, which contradicts the testimony that claims they are. So the testimony (Testimony 5) claims that only Simeon's prints are unnatural, but the evidence shows that Saint had a legitimate reason to handle the chessboard, making the prints natural. Therefore, Evidence 3 contradicts Testimony 5. But wait, Testimony 3 says they found Saint's fingerprints on the chessboard. The evidence in 3 says it was brought by Saint, so that's expected. So the contradiction would be Testimony 3's implication that Saint's fingerprints are incriminating, but Evidence 3 shows a legitimate reason for them being there. However, Testimony 5 says that only Saint's prints are unnatural. The natural presence from handling the chessboard as per Evidence 3 would contradict Testimony 5's claim of unnaturalness. So the pair would be Evidence 3 and Testimony 5. Let me check the numbers. Testimony 5 is index 5, and Evidence 3 is index 3. So the answer should be {"evidence": 3, "testimony":5}.
